definition: (coll.) (a woman's) close female friend/bestie/(originally written 閨密|闺密, an abbr. for 閨中密友|闺中密友)
small arched door/boudoir/lady's chamber/by ext. women

sentences.english: Or maybe you're always blanking out on your buddy's husband's name.
sentences.chinese: 或者你總是記不起來你閨蜜老公的名字？

sentences.english: Bestie, in fact, is another own.
sentences.chinese: 閨蜜，其實就是另一個自己。

sentences.english: Today i went to kyoto again to see geisha dance, with Noriko and Rie.
sentences.chinese: 今天和兩個日本閨蜜一起去京都看藝妓表演的舞蹈。

sentences.english: She and I than what, even if I was her best ie.
sentences.chinese: 她什麼都要和我比，即使我是她閨蜜。

sentences.english: And, in common with many of my friend's husbands, Colin regularly complains that this just isn't enough.
sentences.chinese: 跟我很多閨蜜的老公一樣，科林也常常對此牢騷滿腹。

definition: original poster (in an online forum)/landlord of a building (traditional)
It is said that ... (at the start of a narrative)/to discuss/to recount
Brothers!/brethren/dude (colloquial)/brother (diminutive form of address between males)
to come to an agreement/to complete negotiations
(romantic) love/CL:個|个[ge4],場|场[chang3]/in love/to have an affair
lit. that person/fig. the person you have been looking for/Mr Right/the girl of one's dreams
